statement:
For any finite family $(a_i)_{i\in I}$ of real numbers in the interval
$[0,1]$, we have $$\prod_i(1-a_i)\ge 1-\sum_ia_i\;.$$ **Proof:** Write
$$f=\prod_i(1-a_i)+\sum_ia_i\;.$$ For any $k\in I$, and any fixed values
of the $a_i$ for $i\ne k$, $f$ is a polynomial of the first degree in
$a_k$. Consequently $f$ is minimal either at $a_k=0$ or $a_k=1$. That
brings us down to two cases: all the $a_i$ are zero, or at least one of
them is $1$. But in both cases it is clear that $f\ge 1$, QED.
